section.title: Import Collection
section.para: As was explained in the Export Documentary Collection chapter, Documentary Collection is a method of payment used in international trade, whereby the exporter entrusts the handling of trade documents to banks and gives the banks instructions concerning the release of these documents to the importer.
The two most common conditions for release are:

listitem.para: Documents will be released only if the importer makes immediate payment according to the contracted agreement between the exporter and the importer. Also known as a sight Collection.
Documents will be released only if the importer accepts the accompanying draft, thereby incurring an obligation to pay at a specified future date. Also known as a term Collection.

section.para: Whereas the Export Documentary Collection module provides an interface for the drawer (the exporter) to request an Documentary Collection, this module (IC) provides an interface for the drawee (the importer) to receive and follow up a Documentary Collection.

section.title: Terminology
section.para: Within this section of the help guide, "IC", "Import Collection" and "Import Documentary Collection" are used interchangeably. The terms "record" and "transaction" both refer to entries in the system relating to the function being discussed.

section.title: Overview
section.para: The module enables you, on behalf of your company (which is the drawee and buyer and importer) to receive notification of Documentary Collections, and subsequent updates, from the Presenting/Collecting Bank. You can also send messages back to the bank for events that require your approval or acceptance in the ongoing transaction flow.

section.title: Import Collection - Navigation
section.para: To navigate to the Import Collection, from the toolbar, select Trade Services > Import Collection.

section.title: Import Collection Functions
section.para: The menu for this module has the following groups of functions. All are basically as described in the chapter Functions.

listitem.para: Send a free-format message to the Presenting Bank regarding an Import Collection that the bank has notified you of. A typical use of this feature could be for you to state your acceptance of the documents presented by the drawer and his Remitting Bank.
View all existing IC Initiations that are not yet complete or have not been submitted.
Search for existing ICs based on specific search criteria.
Maintain Unsigned, Purged and Rejected ICs

section.title: Message to Bank
section.para: This section describes the Message to Bank part of the menu and the forms it uses.

section.title: Message to Bank Options
section.para: This part of the menu contains several options, providing different ways to send a free-format message to the Presenting Bank.

A typical use is state your acceptance or refusal of a set of documents presented by the exporter.
From Existing IC
This Option displays a list of existing Import Collections, that is, Import Collections that your company (the main beneficiary) has received notification of from the Presenting Bank.
Edit Transactions
Review, complete and submit Import Collection records that you or another user have already created and saved, but not submitted.
Retrieve Unsigned
Review and submit Import Collection records that you or another user have created, but have not been submitted due to lack of authority.

section.title: Message to Bank - From Existing IC
section.para: When this function is selected, a list of existing Import Collections records is displayed.
The list can be searched by entering search criteria in the System Id, Entity, Bank Reference, Drawer or Currency fields.
The list is not displayed until you have entered search criteria and clicked Search. To display all records, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.

The columns returned in the list are described in the following table:

section.title: Message to Bank - Edit Transactions
section.para: This option allows Message to Bank records that you or another user have already started and saved, to be completed.

When selected, this option will present a list of Message to Bank records that have been prepared and saved by users in your bank, but not yet submitted to the clients because the input user either did not try to submit or had insufficient privileges.
Click in the System Id column to open a message for further editing.

section.title: Message to Bank - Retrieve Unsigned
section.para: This option allows Message to Bank records that you or another user have already started but been unable to submit, to be submitted by an authorised user.

When selected, this option will present a list of Message to Bank records that have been prepared and saved by users in your bank, but have not been successfully submitted to the clients because the user had insufficient privileges. Records that were simply saved with no attempt to submit them are not included.

Click in the System Id column to open the record in a non-editable mode, in order to review the data and perform the submission. When clicked, the Audit Trail icon will display the user that created the transaction, and any users that have edited, authorised or verified it.

If you have sufficient authorisation in your profile, you can submit multiple records in a single operation directly from the list. Each record in the list has a check box which you tick to select it. A button at the end of the page submits all the selected records.

The result of the action is then returned, with a list of records that have now been successfully sent to the clients, together with a list of records that have again failed validation. The updated list of unsigned records is then also displayed.

section.title: Pending ICs
section.para: This function will display a list of all Message to Bank records that have not been approved by the bank. These can be edited or submitted as required by any user with the appropriate authorities.
The list can be searched by entering search criteria in the System Id, Entity or Drawer fields.
The list is not displayed until you have entered search criteria and clicked Search.To display all records, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.

The columns returned in the list of Pending ICs are the following:
Field
Description

Entity

The type of record. (New, etc.)
Status
The status of the IC. (Incomplete, Draft, Etc.)
Drawer
The name of the Drawer.
Input
The date of creation or last modification.
Users

icon in the left hand column of the entry.
Submitted entries may only be viewed.

section.title: IC Maintenance
section.para: This function is user to maintain Import Collection records that were created, but are no longer required in the system.

section.title: IC Maintenance - Set Entity
section.para: List all ICs and associate an Entity. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.

Click Set Entity and then select System ID. You can now set an entity for the LC by clicking the search icon
from the Entity field. Click the Submit button to complete the changes.

section.title: IC Maintenance - Set Reference
section.para: Assign a customer reference to an IC record that currently has none.
When you select this option, you are presented with a list of records that have no reference assigned. Click in the System Id column to open a form where you can assign a reference to the record.

note.para: This action is not validated against the Jurisdiction matrix. All transactions of the current files are updated.

section.title: IC Maintenance - Action Required
section.para: List all ICs which require an action by customers. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.
Click System ID to open and create a free format IC message for the action required.

section.title: IC Maintenance - Unsigned ICs
section.para: List and optionally delete unsigned (unauthorised) Import Collection transactions.

When you select this option, you are presented with a list of records that are unsigned (unauthorised). You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction, and can only use its data for inquiry purposes.
You can delete one or more records in a single operation placing a tick in the check box on the left of the entry, and clicking the Delete selected transactions button at the bottom of the page.

section.title: IC Maintenance - Purged ICs
section.para: List and optionally delete Import Collection transactions that have been marked as Purged by the Issuing Bank's Trade Services team. You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction, and can only use its data for inquiry purposes.
You can delete one or more records in a single operation placing a tick in the check box on the left of the entry, and clicking the Delete selected transactions button at the bottom of the page.
